content.data: Specialized Drill and Dowel

This Machine Type is specifically for Drill and Dowel Machines. Following 
 are the Setup Tab options for Specialized Drill and Dowel:
Setup Tab - Specialized Drill & Dowel

The fields defined below will only be available if your Drill & 
 Dowel supports the feature the field defines.
Depth Match Group

Face Up -  This setting 
	 will force the program to be written either face up or down regardless 
	 of if the part is face up/down on the nest or saw.

Face Up -  This setting 
	 will force the program to be written either face up or down regardless 
	 of if the part is face up/down on the nest or saw.

Face Up -  This setting 
	 will force the program to be written either face up or down regardless 
	 of if the part is face up/down on the nest or saw.
image688.gif

You can override the up/down flag on an individual part with the DNDFLIP 
 parameter.
Information.png

Face Up 
 with Label-IT

Below is sample output for 2 different edge 
 machines. Each machine has a different Face Up setting.

The arrows will indicate how the part should 
 be fed into the machine and since this part was on the saw Face Down that 
 the Face Up program(s) require the part to be flipped.

When two programs share the same name but 
 different Face Up/Down requirements then multiple arrows will be shown 
 to accommodate. The arrows will coincide with the machine tags field.

Note that when this part is BU (back up) 
 it has a Left and Bottom program. When it is flipped Face Up, it has a 
 Right and Bottom program. The L,R,B,T programs are always relative to 
 the primary edge of the part and if the parts is Face Up/Down.
image89.gif

In the past the Label was always rotated 
 so that the Arrow pointed to the primary edge of the part. However there 
 was a disconnect with this rotation and how the part appears on the Label 
 in Label-IT. In Label-IT the part is always rotated 90 degrees since parts 
 are typically longer then they are wide to maximize the part image.

Now the label is always rotated so that it 
 points to a part length.

In the image depicted below we have the same 
 part with 4 different primary edges. The primary edge corresponds with 
 the part number. In the past the 2nd parts label would point to the right 
 and the 4th parts label would point left. In the new scheme the part with 
 the primary edge of 2 or 4 have the same rotation as a part with 1 or 
 3 respectively.

Note that the position of the label has not 
 changed, only the rotation.
image341.jpg

Silent 
 Mirrored Programs

If a part is shaped there may be difficulty 
 lining up the part on the fence of the machine on its shaped side. We 
 now output a silent mirrored program for all shaped parts. The mirrored 
 program can be run on the opposite fence if needed.

Note that the mirrored program will still 
 have the same Face Up/Down orientation as the primary program. In essence 
 only the X-Position is mirrored (not the Z).

These additional programs will only occur 
 for shaped parts.

The Barcodes on the Label Image will be for 
 the primary edge program. The operator will need to be trained/informed 
 that there is an additional program if necessary.
The edge program has a new naming convention:
Previously

R010011L (Run Number R01) (PartID 0011) 
 (Edge L = Left)
New

R01P00BL (Run Number R01) (Primary or Mirrored 
 P/M) (PartID in base 36 00B) (Edge L = Left)

R01M00BL (Run Number R01) (Primary or Mirrored 
 P/M) (PartID in base 36 00B) (Edge L = Left)

With Base 36, the three 3 characters reserved 
 for PartID can now store 46,655 unique IDs from 000 to ZZZ

If the part is shaped the program will output 
 a R01M* program in addition to the R01P*

All D & D output except for the  Weeke 
 BEK  that describes the entire part now feature the mirrored programs.
EXAMPLE OUTPUT
R78P00DL:

Edge 
 Width

Number 
 Of Holes

Hole 
 1

Hole 
 2
R78M00DL:

Edge 
 Width

Number 
 Of Holes

Hole 
 1

Hole 
 2

Drill Match Depth 
	 -  Specifies to the S2M Center when to send a Drill only code 
	 to your Drill and Dowel. Match Depths are used to specify a trigger 
	 to output the correct codes to your Machine. See Match Depth explanation 
	 below.

image1490.gif

Match 
 Depth Explanation

In the grid below I have defined 4 different 
 Match Depths (Triggers) for each Operation Type. The dimension used here 
 are a bit extreme. You would probably define them with about .001 difference 
 when you actually utilize it.

Drill Match 
		 Depth

Dowel Match 
		 Depth

KD Match 
		 Depth

Glue Match 
		 Depth

In this situation if I passed a Horizontal 
 Bore Operation through the S2M Center that was 1/8 Deep the Machine would 
 Drill Only.

If I passed a  Deep Operation it would 
 Drill and Insert a Dowel. This would be used for inserting glue-less dowels.

If I passed a 3/8 Deep Operation it would 
 Drill and Insert a KD Fitting (If your Machine supports it, otherwise 
 this field will not be available.)

If I passed a  Deep Operation it would 
 Drill, Inject Glue, and Insert a Dowel.
